storyInfo: Thiago is killed by a burnt cultist. Before his death, Thiago fails to learn the truth behind his former lover and the downfall of his town. Aboard the Stultifera Navis, the Seaborn's evolution cannot be stopped, but Irene finally raises her handcannon.

attributes.content: Ugh... What happened?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You're awake!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I'm begging you man, at least holler the next time something like this happens, alright? Pull another stunt like that, and I won't be able to save you!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: How's the situation? That woman's monsters... Have they all been burned away yet?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I can't say for sure, but probably. I mean, I've only seen the full extent of Mon3tr's firepower in tactical records before.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...Burn it. Burn it all.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Gran Faro is already a thing of the past. Just burn it all down.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Mr. Thiago, you—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Ahh, traitor! And you, Iberian! I've caught your scents. This is where you're hiding!
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: You came at just the right time. Yes, yes, just the right time—!
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: —What are you?!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hmph. Already blind and beyond recognition. Serves him right for pleasuring himself with that monster!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Serves you right! You hear me?!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Serves me right? Hah, it sure does, Thiago. For choosing to trust a man blinded by hatred, for ever having delusions that people like you could be saved. Serves me right, indeed.
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: But now, everything... is... different. (Bones grind and crunch together)
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: –-Sea Terrors? But when?!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Thiago, don't get too close! Something's wrong with this guy!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Iberia must be destroyed! We will annihilate this country. This land will become the ocean's cradle. The waves shall swallow the clouds, and scores of mountains will dissolve without a sound—
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: We shall— all— become— one!!
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: Watch out! Thiago!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Guh?! *cough*—!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Thiago! Tch, he's already transforming into a monster! Just like in the reports from Sal Viento!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I'll start with you, traitor.
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: For the perpetuation of life eternal, Iberia... is... meaningless!
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: Meaningless, you say?
Are you calling for me by name, heretic?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...High Inquisitor, you made it just in time.
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: Go ahead and pray. We will prove to you that your god is meaningless too. You will watch as Iberia sinks into the abyss.
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: That will never happen.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: My name is... Carmen I Iberia. When the nine saints gave themselves this false title, they abandoned their own names—and with it, their beliefs.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We are immolated by lies. Nobody knows this better than us. God never offered salvation to Iberia. We must become our own gods.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: On behalf of the Inquisition, I hereby read your sentence, heretic.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: What is this heaviness I feel?
My body has already been accepted by my kin. My life has already received sublimation.
So why? Why am I unable to take my eyes off his lantern?
Self-preservation? Yes, all Inquisitors are quite powerful, so I am on guard.
You may kill me, but you cannot kill our kind. Kill our kind, and the sea will die. When the sea dies, the land will die with it.
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: You will all eventually drown in the rising tide of evolution. You will not live to see this land's future! This era is bloated and discordant, and we are all but livestock trapped in cages!
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: I will put you and your Inquisition—
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: He looks at his body in disbelief. A beautiful cross-section.
Since their invasion of Gran Faro began, the old Inquisitor who sat at the town's chapel has never lifted his hand even once.
He never wielded his sword, or drew his handcannon. He used only his lantern and his Arts, befitting someone as ancient as him.
Yes, ancient. He is very old. A span of time far too great for the ordinary life to endure.
Land-crawling... livestock... How did you...?
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: At least I was... able to... buy...
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: You've accomplished nothing.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: A brand new lifeform, yet unable to take the life of even this old Iberian. What do you have to be proud of?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Look at me, heretic.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You... *cough*, *cough*... Damn you!
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: You were once human too. But you narrow-mindedly misjudged the potential of your own race.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: For tens of thousands of years, this is how we have won our wars. Nature selects, life adapts.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You, and your pathetic ideas, will be buried in Iberia. Before your last breath, be sure to pass on our thunderous roar to your kin.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: 'The sea faces an ancient enemy called civilization, one you stand no chance of overcoming.'
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You... Gurk... You... you understand nothing...
attributes.name: Burnt Cultist

attributes.content: How's he doing?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I've been trying everything I could this whole time! But the wound's too deep!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: If only Dr. Kal'tsit were here. He needs medical attention immediately, sir! Where is she?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Waiting in the chapel.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I should make this clear, member of Rhodes Island. His treason is indefensible, and he must answer for his crimes.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Knowingly sheltering the Church of the Deep's cultists has caused the Inquisition to lose a prime opportunity. It has also placed Dario and countless of our brothers in the Penal Battalion in grave peril.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...Tch, old fool.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: How old are you anyway? A hundred? How do you... ugh... still pretend to have so much energy?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: It is my duty.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: So you must... *cough*, *cough*... urgh... know all sorts of things...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Tell me, Inquisitor. Tell me the truth, you wretched executioner...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Why would you... urgh... destroy a band of people... hoping to rebuild... their home?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: All of you... All of you...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Don't speak, Thiago! I can't stop the bleeding!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Ha... Hah... No, I must ask.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: All of you, the Inquisition! Those Ægir you took from Gran Faro... were there really any cultists among them?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Tell me... Did you really, out of... *cough*, paranoia... nothing more than a laughable paranoia... kill all those good people?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Ordinary citizens have no right to know the Inquisition's secrets.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: You bastard...!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Knowing the truth will not help you cling onto your fading life, Thiago.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: No, no no no... I'm begging you... I'm begging you... I'm going to die, and you still won't tell me the truth...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: At least... Marin... Tell me...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The files on Gran Faro's Ægir have been sealed. I am unable to disclose anything to a civilian.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: ...No... *cough*, *cough*... Gah...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I... Curse you. I swear, I'll never forgive you!
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Iberia... Ibe... will...
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: His malediction never leaves his mouth.
Old Thiago looks at the dim, damp ceiling, where a drop of water is about to fall from the wooden beams.
Drip.
He’s gone.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: So, what's the truth?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I don't see how this has anything to do with you either, member of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Return to Kal'tsit. We've lost too much time, and the Eye of Iberia will likely fall.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Please. Tell me.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: As a member of Rhodes Island, I also wish to cooperate with the Inquisition. But before that, I'm an Iberian.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I didn't know Thiago for very long. But I just realized... he would never curse Iberia. Because he truly saw this place as his home.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: But after realizing that, that's all the more reason I can't just...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Lord Carmen, after witnessing so many tragedies in my homeland, surely you can't just... tell me to turn a blind eye to it all.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Carmen glances over at the aged laborer resting in Elysium's arms. His eyes betray a slightly different emotion.
After a moment of silence, he speaks.

Roughly a hundred thirty Ægir were taken from Gran Faro, and of them, about half had ties with the Church of the Deep. Even some members of the Penal Battalion formerly stationed in the town were revealed to be traitors.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: They stole a large amount of information on Iberia's Seafaring Era, obstructed the Inquisition, and were plotting from the very beginning to turn Gran Faro into a nexus for the sea's invasion of the land.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Leading them was a female bishop, an Ægir Islander. A woman the people called 'Marin.'
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Now, give him his burial.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Strong. Work together, and you are strong enough to lead our kind.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: But, you do not plan to do this. This puzzles me.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Our kind, how will you treat them?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Willpower, begets all. Any chasm, can be crossed.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Our environment, complete and pure. Impurities, are not needed.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: About parents, I am trying to find an answer. Yet the question, is not clear. I cannot ask yet.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Sound of bones grinding and rubbing)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Do all of the sea's infants learn to talk as quickly as you?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What's wrong, Mister Captain? Has your loneliness finally compelled you to seek companionship with talking Seaborns?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You know, every wound on its body has been MY handiwork so far.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: *Spit*.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: It's still alive and kicking. We're just getting to the good part.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: ...Fighting, is meaningless.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Leaving, is the correct choice.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ugh, get back here!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: It tore through the wall and fled. Why did the Iberians have to make this ship so complex anyway?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I won't allow it to continue trashing my ship. Garcia!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: That's cheating, you know~
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: How do you think we managed to keep this ship from getting riddled with holes and sinking, while surrounded by monsters for all these years? Relying solely on Breogan's technology?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: We systematically kill the ones threatening enough to cause damage. Then, little by little, the survivors slowly sew up the scars they left behind.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: This one can be considered intelligent, as far they go, but it's by no means the strongest.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I'm not in the mood to play games with you anymore, so this farce ends here. Kill it now, before it does something we can't undo.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The fleeing Seaborn easily tears through the ship's walls. It can smell its kin as well as the ocean just outside this strange box.
It is hurt. It needs healing. It needs nourishment. It needs time. The scaleless kin had bought it a chance to breathe, but far from enough time.
Many preparations are yet to be completed.
What?! A Seaborn!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The Seaborn does not speak.
Because it faces something that is not its kin. Not kin that speaks. Not kin without scales.
In which case, the small, fragile creature struggling before its eyes is just an ordinary lifeform. Just another part of the Cycle.
It should be consumed.
After coming to this conclusion, the Seaborn almost immediately lashes out at Irene with tooth and claw.
(So fast! Its body is different from before?!)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: It's so tough?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Merda— I can't dodge it this time—)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Roars)
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: (Eldritch noises) Stand... up... and run...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: You... You can talk?! In Iberian?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (Eldritch noises) I... save you. Don't let... him know.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: (Eldritch noises) Don't let... Alfonso... know I'm... still human.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Language, you also know it.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Efficiency, relatively low. Not enough information, not enough time. If necessary, I will complete it.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Kindred, you have formed your own group. And your offspring, consume one another.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You, are incomplete.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Eldritch noises) Alfonso... cannot... get here fast.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: (Eldritch noises) You... run.
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Kindred, no point in nurturing.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Flesh and blood, donate to us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Howling) —!
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Still attempting to spit out vestiges of human speech, the chief mate is punctured by the Seaborn's fangs.
It neither underestimates its enemy nor is distracted by Irene's presence. The Seaborn's motions have clearly evolved.
You...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: Alfonso... Hurry... Hurry...
attributes.name: Chief Mate

attributes.content: (I can't even pierce its carapace!)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: (At this rate, I...)
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Irene. You know where this is.
Yes! It's the Inquisition's—
Underground. Where every High Inquisitor has seen the truth.
The truth...
Consider this one thing, Irene. What is the Inquisition fighting for?
For Iberia's purity and virtue, for the sanctity of our Laws and Scriptures.

But what if the concept of truth as seen by the people is only superficial? What if the Law has no reach, the Scriptures fail to prophesize, and the morality that governs all things amounts to naught? How will you pass down judgment then?
I... will judge based on my own standards.
Even if it means casting aside the distinction between good and evil that you've always adhered to?
Of course!
That is easier said than done, Irene. There's no point trying to teach from my example, and I'm not as partial towards words as you are.
Maestro...
But.

There will come a day when your enemies will force you to cast aside everything you've ever known. Your faith, your morals, your ethics. Everything will be ravaged, desecrated, rendered null and void.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: When that happens, if you can manage to rebuild your inner faith, whatever it may be, then that will form the foundation to help you defeat those enemies.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: Before seeing the truth, before experiencing a crueler history, everything that we do is empty, with no basis in reality.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: I won't tell you how you should act going forward. But when that time comes, I want you to remember my words, Irene.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: You must become Iberia's last line of defense.
attributes.name: High Inquisitor Dario

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Survival, is not actually your goal. Perhaps, you can become something greater.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Irene raises her handcannon.
A second cavity suddenly appears in the Seaborn's adamantine body, as a torrential flow of heat melts through its sturdy, unusual walls.
The surging temperature turns the surroundings into a sea of fire. The chief mate sobs and retreats to the side, staring blankly at the scene before its eyes.
The Seaborn has never been enveloped by such Arts before. It feels a sense of being overwhelmed, but quickly adapts.
However, the Inquisitor's barrage will not cease until the flames of her lantern sputter out.
Release the chief mate, you monster. And get a good whiff of the scent of Originium.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: You have not sinned in any way. The Holy Scriptures do not even mention your existence.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Right now it is only I, as an Iberian, who is handing down this verdict.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The scourge of the seas must be wiped out. You have no right to live.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: In the name of Iberia.
attributes.name: Irene
